intro: Swertia obtusa var. stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled swertia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
